intro: Enantia chlorantha var. soyauxii, commonly known as the Soyaux's enantia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically arranged in opposite pairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
